title: Macron replaces controversial education minister in reshuffle
summary: Amélie Oudéa-Castéra was minister of education, sports and the Olympics for less than a month. She returns to her old position – minister of sports and the Olympics – while Nicole Belloubet becomes education minister.

title: Three actresses accuse director Jacques Doillon of rape, sexual assault and harassment
summary: Judith Godrèche, Anna Mouglalis and Isild le Besco told Le Monde about the behavior of the author of 'The 15 Year Old.' Doillon's lawyer says he will reserve his explanations for the courts.

title: Zelensky ousts Ukrainian army reformer Valery Zaluzhny
summary: The 50-year-old general radically restructured his country's armed forces and cultivated a favorable reputation beyond military circles. On the front line since the Russian invasion, he was replaced on Thursday by ground forces commander Oleksandr Syrsky.

title: Biden cleared of charges in documents probe, mental capacity questioned
summary: The special counsel's report criticized Biden's mishandling of classified materials but ruled out charges. It also described the US president as an 'elderly man with a poor memory.'

title: Senegal's election postponement: 'This goes to the heart of our democratic model'
summary: El Hadji Omar Diop is a lecturer and researcher in public law at the Université Cheikh-Anta-Diop (UCAD) in Dakar. He explained the 'artificially created' institutional crisis.

title: Poland's government is trying to abolish homework
summary: An election promise made by the new majority has provoked an outcry from teachers and education experts, who were not consulted and worry that it will widen disparities among students.

title: Trump's fate lies in the hands of the Supreme Court, a key player in the presidential election
summary: The highest court in the United States is set to rule on both the total immunity claimed by the former president during his term of office and his participation in the Republican primaries in Colorado and Maine.

title: Prosecutors demand trial for director Christophe Ruggia over alleged abuse of Adèle Haenel
summary: French film director Christophe Ruggia has been charged with sexually assaulting actress Adèle Haenel when she was a minor.

title: Paris 2024: Each Olympic and Paralympic medal will have a piece of the Eiffel Tower
summary: The design of the 5,000 awards was revealed on Thursday. The jeweller Chaumet incorporated fragments of iron plates from the Eiffel Tower.

title: Huawei searched by French prosecutors on suspicion of improper conduct
summary: The raids were carried out as part of a preliminary investigation launched by France's financial prosecution service (PNF).

title: Israel-Hamas war: The long wait for displaced persons in southern Lebanon
summary: More than 86,000 local residents have fled their homes due to border clashes between Hezbollah and the Israeli army. The neediest are housed in collective shelters in precarious conditions.

title: ECHR faults France for police 'kettling' tactic
summary: The method involves large cordons of police officers containing a crowd in a limited area. The European Court of Human Rights found France guilty of using the tactic during a 2010 demonstration.

title: Last anti-Putin candidate Nadezhdin barred from Russian election
summary: Russia's election commission on Thursday refused to allow Boris Nadezhdin to run for the upcoming presidential election.

title: France recorded over 5,000 deaths due to summer 2023 heat
summary: Around 3,700 of the deaths were people aged over 75. Extreme heat has been straining healthcare systems, hitting older people, infants and children.

title: Icelandic volcano erupts for third time since December
summary: Lava spewed on the Reykjanes Peninsula, near the town of Grindavik which was evacuated because of the earlier eruption.

title: Biden mistakes dead leader for living one, again
summary: The president of the United States said he spoke with Helmut Kohl in June 2021. The former German chancellor passed away in 2017.

title: Netanyahu rejects Gaza ceasefire and hostage deal, calls Hamas's demands 'delusional'
summary: Refusing to give in to Hamas's 'delusional' demands, the Israeli prime minister threatened to extend ground operations to the Egyptian border.

title: Fukushima operator reports leak, says no contamination detected
summary: Highly radioactive water leaked from a treatment machine at the tsunami-hit Fukushima nuclear power plant, but no one was injured and radiation monitoring shows no impact to the outside environment, the utility operator said Thursday.

title: El Salvador unveils ultra-modern national library gifted by China
summary: The new national library in San Salvador, which President Nayib Bukele highlighted to secure his re-election, is one of Beijing's gifts to the country in exchange for its support. However, the facility places limited emphasis on reading.
